com.aloqa.trax.client.saps
Interface PositionSource

All Known Subinterfaces:
PositionProvider
public interface PositionSource

This interface provides a high-level abstraction of a locally available positioning method. Basically, it identifies the type of a positioning method, and it allows to switch a positioning method on or off (enable/disable). Note that only one PositionSource can be enabled at a time.

Field Summary
static byte IDENTIFIER_GPS
          Identifies a PositionSource to use GPS.
static byte IDENTIFIER_SIMULATION
          Identifies a PositionSource to use simulated (artificial) data.
 
Method Summary
 byte getIdentifier()
          Returns an identifier that tells which positioning method is used.
 boolean isEnabled()
          Checks whether this PositionSource is enabled.
 void setEnabled(boolean how)
          Either disables or enables this PositionSource.

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getIdentifier

byte getIdentifier()
Returns an identifier that tells which positioning method is used.

Returns:
An identifier for a positioning method, cp. IDENTIFIER_GPS and IDENTIFIER_SIMULATION.

isEnabled

boolean isEnabled()
Checks whether this PositionSource is enabled.

Returns:
true, if this PositionSource is enabled.

setEnabled

void setEnabled(boolean how)
Either disables or enables this PositionSource.

Parameters:
how - If set to true, then this PositionSource is enabled and -- if technically possible -- immediately starts to deliver positions. All other locally available positioning methods are immediately disabled. If set to false, then this PositionSource is disabled and immediately stops to deliver positions.
